content: The Act may be cited as the "State Sanctions Against Iranian Terrorism Act" and grants authority to state and local governments to restrict investment activities in Iran. Section 202 of the Comprehensive Iran Sanctions, Accountability, and Divestment Act of 2010 is amended to specify that no interference should occur in the business sector of Iran until all Federal laws authorizing sanctions on Iran are rescinded by Congress. Section 202 of the Comprehensive Iran Sanctions, Accountability, and Divestment Act of 2010 is amended to give authority to restrict investment in Iran, including adopting and enforcing measures to prohibit or limit investment activities in Iran. Interstate compacts can also be entered into regarding these measures. Section 202 of the Comprehensive Iran Sanctions, Accountability, and Divestment Act of 2010 is amended to enforce measures restricting investment in Iran, including disclosure and transparency requirements. Amendments include lowering the threshold for imposing restrictions to $10,000,000 and expanding restrictions to any business enterprise in Iran. Amendments to Section 202 of the Comprehensive Iran Sanctions, Accountability, and Divestment Act of 2010 include lowering the investment threshold to $10,000,000 and expanding restrictions to any business enterprise in Iran, including those owned or controlled by the Government of Iran. Nonpreemption clause ensures state and local government measures are consistent with U.S. federal policy and foreign policy. Amendments to Section 202 of the Comprehensive Iran Sanctions, Accountability, and Divestment Act of 2010 include defining "own or control" for entities, and expanding subsections (h) to include (i) and (j). Amendments to Section 202 of the Comprehensive Iran Sanctions, Accountability, and Divestment Act of 2010 include adding subsections (i) and (j) and clarifying the applicability of prior provisions. Amendments to Section 202 of the Comprehensive Iran Sanctions, Accountability, and Divestment Act of 2010 include provisions for divestment or prohibition of investment in entities engaging in activities in Iran. The text chunk discusses amendments to the Comprehensive Iran Sanctions, Accountability, and Divestment Act of 2010, specifically regarding investment activities in Iran and exemptions from certain provisions. The heading for title II of the Comprehensive Iran Sanctions, Accountability, and Divestment Act of 2010 is amended. The heading for section 202 of the Comprehensive Iran Sanctions, Accountability, and Divestment Act of 2010 is amended to give state and local governments the authority to restrict investment activities in Iran. The table of contents is also updated to reflect these changes. The amendments in this Act grant State and local governments the authority to restrict investment activities in Iran. These amendments apply to measures adopted after the enactment date of the Act, with exceptions outlined in section 202(j) of the Comprehensive Iran Sanctions, Accountability, and Divestment Act of 2010.
